data.title: It's expensive for average tasting food
data.text: We stopped here to get something "special "for a friend.While we were there, we decided to get some cookies for ourselves. The quality was not superior to the cookies I make, but they were a lot more expensive! We don't plan to make a repeat visit.

data.title: Delicious sandwich and a free cookie!
data.text: The motto on the wall says, "Life is short, eat the cookie." I love that they give a free cookie with the sandwich. I stopped in as I was exploring the town, having just moved here. It's a fun little cafe! There aren't too many options on the menu, but the Turkey Delight was awesome! You also have your choice of bread. There were several choices of salads along with the handful of choices of sandwiches. Their other cookies are huge and delicious. I'm glad I stopped by!

data.title: A cute sandwich place
data.text: Friendly staff, and I was pleasantly surprised. Reasonable prices, very sweet cakes, brilliantly peaceful atmosphere

data.title: Fresh food
data.text: Stopped for lunch and 2 had sandwiches 1 had salad. All fresh and made to order. Each came with small homemade chocolate chip cookie. Yum!

data.title: Great sandwich's
data.text: Enjoyed some excellent sandwich's at Sweet Cakes during my stay in Mesa. Plenty of home made treats.

data.title: Delicious Cinnamon and Caramel Rolls!!!
data.text: We picked up 2 cinnamon rolls and 2 caramel pecan rolls on our way from the airport for breakfast the next day. We all loved the rolls! We were referred by a family member and so glad we checked the place out. We are going to make this a routine stop whenever we have out of state visitors that fly into Gateway Airport. We did not try anything else. The staff were all very friendly. The rolls were HUGE and very good warmed up.

data.title: No cakes but cookies
data.text: This place does serve good sandwiches for lunch. Variety of desserts to choose from. I would highly recommend trying their cookies.

data.title: I love this place for great cupcakes and salads
data.text: i can't think of anyone i know who would not realllllly enjoy Sweet Cakes. It is a little pricey when compared with the grocery store bakeries, but, well worth it.

data.title: Check the menu first
data.text:
Great cookies (they are huge!) BUT have a look at the menu first prior to arriving so as to not be disappointed. The name of the bakery indicates something other than a focus on cookies and few other bits, but the focus is cookies and a few other bits. Not cakes, per se. 

The cashier didn't seem to know the menu or what was offered as I had repeat my order/questions multiple times prior to her understanding/acting. 

The cookies were good but much was wasted by our group because they were that big. Taste was great just not the best experience.

data.title: Treat Yourself to a Little Sweetness!
data.text: Located close to the Mesa Arts Center downtown, Sweet Cakes is a great place to have a sandwich and/or something sweet.  Their signature pieces are the giant cookies, but the cinnamon buns and sandwiches are equally as good!

data.title: More then a little bakery in Mesa, AZ
data.text: My better half's Company Christmas party was held here last night. My first time at this bakery so my initial thought was how can you have a company party at a bakery? When we arrived, you could smell the food,  it smelled really good! The eating area was bigger then I imagined. We were served with steak or chicken, home style green beans, cubed potatoes and a Caesar salad. I was really impressed with the dinner. As I was looking around the bakery, I noticed they have a daily menu and it looked like something I would want to come back and try. I should mention, they also served home made dinner rolls which tasted like Moms. I your in the area, come try this place for coffee and donuts or lunch, I'm sure you will agree, it was worth stopping for!

data.title: Sweet it is!
data.text: If you have a sweet tooth this is the place. A good assortment of pastries and cookies all made fresh every day.

data.title: "Best Food Ever?!?  Not even remotely!
data.text:
A friend and I stopped in to Sweet cakes with high hopes, only to be greatly disappointed.  Not sure how they can be a "bodacious bakery" when they have store bought bread and Costco croissants sitting on a shelf in the kitchen window!  

We ordered two different types of cookies which were mediocre at best.  Sure they were big, but taste was nothing to get excited about. 

We also bought a cinnamon roll, that was cold, in a plastic container and looked like undercooked dough bathed in frosting.  They had one sitting on the shelf, and when I asked if they had any others, the girl at the counter said, "Yeah, we have about 4 or 5 more in back."  And that was it.  I had to ASK her nicely if I could choose from one of those, as I really didn't want to buy the raw looking one so nicely packaged in the clear plastic container up front. 
Well - the ones in back weren't much better, but I went ahead a bought one because my kids saw the "Best Food Ever" show and wanted to try the cinnamon roll.  NOT impressed.  Between four of us trying it, even after being warmed up at home, we all agreed that it was mediocre at best. In fact we didn't even finish it.  Too much frosting, not enough cinnamon roll to make it worth finishing.  And the size of the cinnamon roll was nothing like what was shown on the TLC show.  Half the size at best. 

On the plus side, the prices weren't that bad, but even cheap won't get us to go back.

data.title: Disappointed!
data.text:
We saw Sweet Cakes on the show Best Food Ever. We were in town and wanted to try the cinammon roll they made such a fuss about on the show. It was supposedly a big success. We walked in and asked for the big cinammon roll and they pointed to the last one on the shelf to our right. It was obvious it had been sitting there at least all day, if not longer and was in a plastic container. I thought surely they are going to offer to heat it up. Nope! We also ordered the brownie that's known as the "better than sex brownie". 

We sat down thinking, "ok.. maybe they don't have to be heated up. Maybe they really are that good." Nope! the cinammon roll was the biggest disappointment. Cinnabon is better than this. Heck, the cinammon rolls I make at home out of a tin can are better than this. This cinammon roll was cold, hard, and nothing but icing. I love icing as much as the next person, but I was hoping to taste some cinammon here too. How in the world did this place get on a food show???

Now, the brownie was pretty darn good, and the only thing here that has saved Sweet Cakes from getting less than 3 stars from us. But it honestly was nothing more than a run of the mill bakery. I've had much better in many places. I truly can not imagine what got this place on a Best Food Ever show. If I'm ever in Phoenix/Mesa again, there is no chance I will go out of my way to go here. Not impressed.

data.title: Great Cookies; Good Sandwiches; Bad Soups
data.text: Nice little getaway for a quick bite or just an excellent dessert to top off the evening.  I can't stop thinking about the great cookies.  I bought several to take home and freeze for later.  My wife loves the sandwiches; my experience with sandwiches was good.  The broccoli cheese soup, however, was another story.  Tasted like it came right out of can, almost transparent.

data.title: Yummy sandwiches and sweets stuff
data.text: Decided to stop by for lunch to give it a try yesterday.  All adults had their fajita chicken melt sandwich. Really delicious with moist chicken breast strips, fresh tomato, lettuce, pepper jack cheese and a spicy mayo on a fab fresh ciabatta roll. Mmmmm. Child had a grilled cheese on whole wheat. All served with good dill pickle and fresh baked chocolate chip cookie.  We tasted their lemon bar. SO delicious. Nice people with fast service. Really pleasant. They also have sidewalk seating. Enjoyed it and we will return. Open for breakfast and lunch only. Closed Mondays.

data.title: from a friends recommendation we ate at Sweet Cakes!
data.text:
The sweets are divine!  the snickerdoodle was uber delicious!!!!!  Don't let the sandwich board fool you...if you don't see it ask!  They made a turkey sandwich just for me....with a huge array of bread choices that couldn't be beat!  Woo hoo!  Most sandwich places give you the usual, white and wheat....sourdough and croissant rarely hits the radar! 

My friend who was with us and recommended was a bit disappointed...not sure why, but it was fantastic in the rest of our eyes!

data.title: another find!
data.text: Had the french toast and a tuna sandwich (split with my daughter) - both were great as well as the cookies that we got to go.  Relaxed atmosphere.

data.title: Great recommendation
data.text:
Was at the Cucina Di Vita italian deli and they were out of cheesecake but they 
said to visit Sweet Cakes Cafe and get the seven layer brownie
    Wow best ever

data.title: classy sandwich shop
data.text: I'm not a fan of their cookies, except for the free one you get with your sandwiches. That cookie is literally better than all their other ones. The sandwiches however, are to die for! Have the bacon avocado one of these days, you'll see what i mean!
